website_summaries.verdict: The Garmin Forerunner 235 offers the best value for serious and casual runners looking for an all-in-one running watch and fitness tracker.
pros: The Garmin Forerunner 235 has accurate GPS for tracking runs and a 24/7 wrist-based heart-rate monitor
It can track all-day activities like steps and sleep, and can display notifications from iPhone and Android devices
It's water-resistant and can be worn in the shower or while swimming
cons: Heart rate accuracy drops off during interval training, there are occasional connection and syncing problems and Garmin's Connect app can be confusing to navigate

customer_reviews.title: Love except for one thing.
customer_reviews.text: Love this watch. I recently replaced the band to give it a classier look so I can wear it when I am dressed up as well. It does everything as advertised. My one complaint is that the display could/should be brighter.
customer_reviews.author: Cory Walker

customer_reviews.title: Would not charge - slow manufactuer support
customer_reviews.text: I bought this watch a month ago with great expectations. It would not charge with power. I contacted Garmin support and was asked to do a series of checks, such as rubbing the electric leads with an eraser. I was finally told that new power charging cable would be sent to fix the problem, and it would take 5-7 days to ship. 3 weeks later = no cable! I am going to contact support one last time before returning this product.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph M. Sommer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I'm not too impressed. I've done a few races and the darn thing stops tracking my distance and time. It beeps and goes to the main screen. At the end of the races I tried looking at it to see what happened and it just stops. This was a watch I was on the fence about for a few months, decided to give it a try, and I'm very sad to say it hasn't been working. I'm starting to now use my old Garmin instead which is 10 years old and takes about 10 minutes to locate the satellite.
customer_reviews.author: kelly leahy

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade from Forerunner 10
customer_reviews.text: This new Garmin watch is definitely an upgrade for me from Forerunner 10. Syncs instantly as long as you have Connect app open and Bluetooth enabled. Very light and perfect size for my small wrist (see photo) the band is great especially when sweaty, it doesn't get sticky. Fast charge and the battery last a long time. I like the notification feature of text for me since I don't need to look at my phone. I love how my friends can text me to say WTG on my running. I've used this outdoor trail running and running on my treadmill, pretty accurate on the pace and distance.
customer_reviews.author: Rhea Igarta

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after four months.
customer_reviews.text: This watch appears to be a piece of junk. After only four months it has stopped working. When I try to turn it on it stalls at the Garmin logo screen, and no matter how much trouble-shooting I do, although it starts to work again for one use, the next time I turn it on the same thing happens. Today it refuses to start at all, even after going through trouble-shooting steps. Of course after four months I'm way past the return window, so I wasted a few hundred dollars. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: so much so that it's basically useless unless you are in bright sunlight
customer_reviews.text: Extremely dim display, so much so that it's basically useless unless you are in bright sunlight. I bought the 235 after many years with the functional forerunner 410 which sadly died. Strapping on the 235 was like stepping backwards 10 years. I have no idea what's going on with fitbit, but I'd give them (or anyone, tbh) a careful look before buying this albatross.
customer_reviews.author: J. Key

customer_reviews.title: Excellent durability
customer_reviews.text: After almost a year of using this watch, I still love it. It's the first watch I've had that has truly lived up to the promise of replacing my smart phone on runs. Battery life is excellent, GPS signal is never lost, and the Garmin app is comprehensively informative for mapping and all the stats I need after finishing a run. It also uploads reliably and automatically to Runkeeper and Strava, which I use for different functions.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Cyclist who wanted something better
customer_reviews.text: I'm a cyclist and wanted a gpe watch to track my cycling. It was supposed to be delivered on a Sunday, amazon and USPS both told me it had been. But the post man dropped it off on Monday. The watch pairs with my phone pretty quickly, the app though, takes forever to sync with it. It seems to read my mileage cycling ok, told me I had done 16.59 miles and that jives with the bike's computer. One thing bothers me about it. It is very hard to get this watch to sync with the app.
customer_reviews.author: Vornan19

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this watch but unfortunately it just doesn't live up to expectations. The GPS is good, distances seem fairly accurate. The ability to have workouts sync between your Garmin account and do interval training are great. However, the HR monitor is terrible - sometime it spikes, sometime it flatlines and sometimes it's just way off. I talked to Garmin about this, they sent me a replacement watch and it's equally as bad. The Bluetooth for syncing is also pretty bad, sometimes it's OK, other times it just doesn't work. All in all, very disappointing. At this price I would expect something that works.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Purchased for running
customer_reviews.text: I have owned the Fenix5 for about 2 years. Picked up the 235 for my daughter to train for cross country. The 235 is much lighter and Bluetooth worked after troubleshooting paired with iPad. Used a 235 on a 50 miler called squaw peak 50 and had no issues with battery on 11 hour run. The band was comfortable and the watch is much lighter than the fenix5. I give this a 3 star because the price dropped $15 the day after purchasing. 10% less. Typically watch prices over a couple of weeks before purchasing. Prices higher on weekends. Anyways the gps on the fenix and 235 were the same on 3 mile or less runs. Easy to change bands.
customer_reviews.author: S. J. Poole

customer_reviews.title: Buy an Apple Watch or. Fitbit instead
customer_reviews.text: The GPS on this unit is wonderful that much I can say positively. however, the heart rate monitor is terrible. If you sweat remotely, if you move your hand around your wrist at all, then it immediately becomes inaccurate and reads a significantly lower heart rate than is actually true. Additionally, the smart notifications are pretty stupid. They only deliver whatever notifications you have, it doesn't matter if it's an ambient notification, like an alarm or timer, or if it's an active text message. It treats all of them the exact same. Except for when you're getting a phone call, then you don't get any notification until the missed call notification comes up.
customer_reviews.author: Some guy who buys crap

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2 of these watches for my wife and I. We wanted to upgrade from using our phones to track our runs and walks. Went with the Garmin because of reputation. This was apparently a mistake. We have only had these for 2 months. One of the watches works ok. It crashes and loses data occasionally but nothing major. The other is a piece of garbage. It crashes and loses data continuously to the point where it is unreliable. At this point, we would have been better off saving our money. Trying to work with Garmin to see if we can get a replacement or refund, but not luck get. I would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Returned item
customer_reviews.text: I felt this watch was just too big to wear all of the time, so am considering other watches. Other than being a little too large for my taste, it seemed like a good product. I had a major issue when returning the item, as the seller claimed it was not in the package when it arrived back to them. I was horrified to learn that it had apparently been stolen en route, but TechMatic honored my return and refunded the amount back to me. What a mess, and financial setback for them! Who knows, but it looks like UPS is responsible for the disappearance of the watch!
customer_reviews.author: kelley davis

customer_reviews.title: Totally unreliable
customer_reviews.text: The wrist based HR sensing worked routinely for about a year of light use. After that it has been extremely variable. For the past several months it has not worked at all. I have followed all the instructions I can find from Garmin and other sources to fix it. Complete resets work for a few days and then the HR sensor stops working again. I expected a lot more from a relatively expensive product. This is also not the only Garmin product I have had trouble with. I think the features of their products are good, but the quality as a rule is unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Alex C

customer_reviews.title: Pretty unimpressive
customer_reviews.text: The watch is nice looking and not too bulky. Other than that, I am surprised at how often the watch doesn't work. Either the bluetooth isn't working, or it doesn't get GPS signal in areas where it should. The Garmin app also is pretty poor, however there are some 3rd party apps that are much better than the Garmin one (Strava is the first that comes to mind). It seems like a lazy design that could/should have many more features and function much better. As an engineer, I see endless room for improvement. When it's working, my wife likes it pretty well, even despite the lack of good data organization, utilization and collection. For that reason it gets 3 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Anderson Lindblom

customer_reviews.title: Does not work reliably as a heart rate monitor
customer_reviews.text: I bought this watch to let me know what heart rate zone I am in. I use it six days per week for the past six weeks. On three of those days it will read my heart rate somewhat accurately. On the other days it will read 50 bpm too high or stick on one heart rate. It has some features that work such as distance, time and pace. However this is not a worthwhile heart rate monitor. I have considered getting a chest strap, but don’t know if I’d be throwing good money after bad.
customer_reviews.author: Grant H. Pound

customer_reviews.title: no autosave
customer_reviews.text: I just got my FR235 and went out for a trail run. There are a couple of places where the GPS signal was lost, that happens I suppose but I didn't realize that happened and by the time I did, the lower power mode came on and I lost my data. I was really surprised that 1. it didn't automatically restart when the signal was reacquired and 2. that if it didn't do that, it should at the very very very least save the existing data. I haven't tried the GPS+GLONASS mode yet, hopefully that will avoid this. If not, at least now I know that I may have to restart the run periodically.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: stopped charging after 6 months
customer_reviews.text: Worked great at first. Very cool interface and tracks lots of data. The charging cable is difficult to connect, and badly designed. After 6 months, it stopped charging and turned into very expensive junk. Very frustrating - especially right before a marathon. Garmin Tech support sent a new cable, but there are still issues charging and no easy fix. The charging cable is not a normal micro USB - it's a special shape, and not easy to find a replacement for. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: kelp

customer_reviews.title: I like this a lot!
customer_reviews.text: This Forerunner 235 replaces an old 230 that I broke on a rock 2 months ago. The 235 has the heart rate monitor built in to the watch so no more "wearing a wire" while you workout or sleep. Provides heart rate, resting heart rate & it keeps track of Calories expended so you can keep track of your food intake. I noticed that you burn through the battery faster if you use the tracking device and the HR monitor at the same time. Then you only get about 10-12 hours of battery usage. However you can disable the HR monitor if you're out for a long whatever. Overall, I'm pretty impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Jake Luke

customer_reviews.title: Garmin watches are the best!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Garmin Forerunner I’ve purchased. My first was a Forerunner 230 and I loved it. I sold it to try Apple’s iWatch 4th generation. I quickly realized that was a mistake and purchased this Garmin Forerunner 235. I love the added heart rate monitor over the 230. The data you can mine from the Garmin app is head and shoulders above, in my opinion, what the Apple Watch offers. I love these products and after learning the hard, and expensive way I will only ever wear a Garmin watch moving forward!
customer_reviews.author: Brillhart Family

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed
customer_reviews.text: Worked okay at first, but after about a month the GPS stopped working for recording activity. The sleep tracking didnt work. It always just said I was in light sleep and didnt recognize the periods of time when I was awake and said there was no REM sleep, which is doubtful. Then it started irritating my wrist. I tried washing the watch really well and switching arms, but it still causes irritation. I'm trying to return it through Garmin because the Amazon timeline is already past. Bought it about 2 months ago.
customer_reviews.author: Zoe Restine

customer_reviews.title: Great sports watch EASY TO USE - EASY TO SEE Display A+++
customer_reviews.text: This Garmin watch is excellent - large display - easy toggle from running to biking- accurate stats and connects seamless to Garmin Connect site where you can review your data and daily runs as well as improvement. Map accurate to exactly where we run and live. Highly recommend this watch. Garmin makes excellent gear. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: J. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great Watch
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this when it was on sale for 60% off and I am so happy we did! My husband is an avid runner and loves all the tracking from this watch. He said it is very accurate compared to other brands he has used. The only thing that is somewhat of an issue is the charger. It is a different shape and unlike other ones, so you can't interchange cords, etc. However, the replacement charger is only $11 so we will take it.
customer_reviews.author: Paige Deines

customer_reviews.title: Died after two months
customer_reviews.text: I really like this watch -- super comfortable, light, and works great indoors and outdoors. I replaced a Garmin Forerunner 405, which is like going from rubbing two sticks together to being given a flame thrower. One thing I could never discern was whether this watch had it's own wifi or not - it does not. Bluetooth through the phone (which is super convenient) or USB to the computer. Great watch and does everything I need it to do as a ~30 mile per week runner. MAY 2017 UPDATE -- watch died after recharging after a half marathon. Very disappointed. It's deader than a door nail. I can't believe the crappy product reliability.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Cullen

customer_reviews.title: After one year,  battery is gone.
customer_reviews.text: Hi, I bought my garmin 235 on February of 2018. On march I went on a trail for 10 days, that i wanted to track it with GPS, and on the first day, when I start the training program it would died. Arrived home and took it to the garmin store. Afeter 10 days, I called them and they said it the battery is faling, cannot use it as a watch for more tan 10 hours. I do not live3 in the US, and in my country, no choice, other than through it, after one year. too bad experience.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't sync well with phone
customer_reviews.text: My biggest complaint is that the syncing capability with my phone stopped working after several months. Additionally, the watch face is really large and cumbersome and my hand movements have frequently hit the buttons to set the watch into data collection modes. I was hopeful that this watch would be great for recording running training and keeping track of heart rate and sleep data, but I have been really disappointed. I think I am done with Garmin products.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Schule

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed, not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: The only options you have are run outdoor, run indoor, bike indoor/outdoor and other. Only checks vo2 max if you run outside. My vivoactive 3 did whenever you ran. Also no touch screen you have to press buttons for everything. I just felt for the money I would have more options not less. I loved the vivoactive but after a year the band broke and you can't buy a new band you have to buy an whole new watch. Bluetooth continually goes out, always have to reconnect to phone manually, never reconnects on its own. Thinking of switching to fitbit.
customer_reviews.author: Brandi

customer_reviews.title: Works perfect , Bright Screen , nice looks ...
customer_reviews.text: What can I say? It’s a Garmin product - it’s Perfect. This is my 7th or 8th Garmin product and I’ve been very happy with them all, this one no exception. It works way better in person than resting about it on a web page . The screen is very bright , it captures the GPS satellite signal in a matter of seconds and the software on board and its navigability work great - simple , functional , bright screen , captures you data perfectly , looks nice , very light , very thin ... it’s an Awsome Garmin watch as usual ...
customer_reviews.author: slickwings

customer_reviews.title: Sleek, comfortable watch with plenty of functionality
customer_reviews.text: I have had this product now for roughly a year and a half and been very well pleased with the tracking as well as its versatility. The accuracy level of the readings for everyday walking and exercise is impressive for the price point. There are also many different watch face selections as well as software additions that make this watch stand out. Bluetooth works very well and receives phone notifications with no issue, even with iPhones. Overall this watch is solid, sleek, comfortable with accurate reading.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: After a short ride on the lawn mower, the ...
customer_reviews.text: After a short ride on the lawn mower, the watch's heartbeat monitor became erratic. Thinking I was having heat problems, I went through expensive tests before discovering the monitor did not jive with the results of my stress test. I no longer use the watch and now use a FitBit with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Blackberry Bard

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding value
customer_reviews.text: This is my first workout watch. While this model is a few years old, I am impressed by the overall functionality. Unless you are an elite runner, this device will easily take your workouts to the next level. It is comfortable to wear, reasonably accurate and well integrated with Garmin Connect App. Battery life is better than expected. I have recharged about every 6 days with 4-5 workouts per week. I had to download a 3rd party app to record hikes, but this integrates data well with other running workouts. The initial recovery times seemed way too long. This improved when I manually adjusted my max heart rate. Still learning to use all of the features. Overall Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Quite an upgrade from older models
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Garmin running watch. It is a significant upgrade from my old 405. The options are quite significant: foot pod, gps, coaching, vo2 max, rest time...the list seems endless. Don't like using it for sleep tracking, but that option does seem to work as advertised. Overall, I quite like it. Menu options take a little to get used to, when you do however, it will significantly improve your knowledge of running stats and how to tweak them for the better. The only real gripe is the physical watch does not have a rugged feel and is very lite (although this is a selling point for some). Ill update this review after having it for a while longer.
customer_reviews.author: Flyinggastankmec

customer_reviews.title: Great Watch
customer_reviews.text: Impressed by this watch. I was switching from the TomTom Spark 3 and found the round face, band, and app to be superior. I became obsessed with the sleep tracking and heart rate. I don’t think it’s that accurate but since I went from no info to all the info, it feels impressive. Battery life is not as good as the Spark 3 but since there are so many more features, it’s not a surprise. I often accidentally “start” exercise because of where the buttons are but hopefully I will get used to it.
customer_reviews.author: Kimi L.

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable to wear all day!
customer_reviews.text: So, I have not worn a watch since approx 10 years (thanks to phones!). However, I was looking for an activity tracking smartwatch, and voila. Came across this watch as my friend was using it. Got sold on its sleek design as well as its use. Even though I am wearing a watch after this long, the watch has been very comfortable, even while working out! There are obviously a lot more apps that I believe Garmin can add but I am still maintaining a 5 star rating as of now since it serves my purpose of tracking activities. DO NOT purchase this if you want it to be like an all functional smart watch.
customer_reviews.author: Harsimrat Singh

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set-up, sync, and customize, and holds a charge well.
customer_reviews.text: This was my first Garmin, and I’m very pleased thus far. Set-up and iPhone syncing were fairly easy, and it holds a change nicely. In fact, simply charging while showering may be enough to wear continuously (besides showering) without having to sacrifice wearing for charging. There are also many nice accessories for this device, and many free customizable watch faces. Of course, some data tracking could be improved, but I’m quite pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Gastronome

customer_reviews.title: Love this Garmin running watch
customer_reviews.text: I think that this watch is terrific! It tracks steps and heart rate all the time. Have used it for biking and walking. It collects so much data about the activity. You can see some results on the watch, but can see so much more on Garmin Connect. Pretty easy to use. The battery life is great. The display is really clear and can be configured with many watch faces from Garmin Connect IQ store. Can also add apps from the store. The watch is light and comfortable to wear all the time.
customer_reviews.author: GLN

customer_reviews.title: feels cheap
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this watch to upgrade to something with GPS functionality. I previously had the Vivifit HR. Instantly, it felt chip. The vivifit was glass face, this is plastic. The vivo was touch screen, this has buttons. i figured Iw ould jsut get used to t. I was incorrect. The buttons engage without me pressing them. It is difficult and sluggish to get from screen to screen. It is loud. The backlight barely works. In general, disappointed and I expected more.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth M. Holbrook

customer_reviews.title: It's pretty good, with a few caveats
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this watch for sleep and workout tracking. The workout/heart rate monitoring seems to be working perfectly, but the sleep tracking is not reliable at all, and has never accurately portrayed my actual sleep patterns. The battery life is incredible. I charge my watch once per week, despite wearing it 24/7 and using it every day for various things. Lastly, it constantly tells me to "Move!" Even RIGHT after a one-hour workout. It's kind of a weird feature. Using it with my Google Pixel 2, and it syncs very well with my calendar and notifications.
customer_reviews.author: TEK

customer_reviews.title: great buy
customer_reviews.text: was highly recommended by my running friends and since I used a Apply iwatch which wasn't giving too accurate results on my running activities. very happy i bought great for activity tracking plus smart watch performance is just as good. I wear it all the time and specially since its so light in weight and plus point is that so many strap options/design available on Amazon. very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Aishath Rubeena Naseem

customer_reviews.title: Amazing watch
customer_reviews.text: I bought it because it has 4 fields to show at the same time: distance, elapsed time, pace, heart eate. It was so useful. Then I found that it supports custom data screens and one of them has 8 fields! So now on the same screen I can also see: time, cadence, gps, battery. Unbelievable. My son's apple watch looks like a toy next to it. And the battery lasts 9 hours with HR GPS and GLONASS. I run a marathon with it and I knew exactly what my body could handle at any time.
customer_reviews.author: HDer

customer_reviews.title: Best of breed.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing watch. Previously ran with the 620 and a Mio link for HR. Great for running. Also counts steps for my works wellness requirements so I can ditch my Fitbit. Looks nice enough to wear all day. Also tracks sleep and has vibrating alarm to wake up in the morning and a move reminder for during the day. Also previously had UP band, Fitbit charge, Garmin 620, and Mio link. heart rate accuracy is very good once you get the fit right (not that different from wearing chest strap correctly). I don't work for Garmin.
customer_reviews.author: EBS

customer_reviews.title: Great watch for runners, walkers and cyclists
customer_reviews.text: I used this watch every day. I'm not a huge runner but do run about 5-ish miles a week. I walk much more (~20 miles per week) and occasionally cycle (15-25 miles once or twice per month). The watch works really well for me to track my heart rate, miles traveled, and pace. The ap works well for me to track performance across time. I'd recommend it (and I bought one for my wife too).
customer_reviews.author: R. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Great Runner Watch
customer_reviews.text: This is the best runner watch I ever had. The battery life is great (lasts me about 4 days without charging), and it gives you real-time information that you want during your run. The HR monitor is a little off (i.e., inaccurate). However, it gives you consistant measurement so I am not too concerned. I was thinking about getting Fenix 5 plus but I am glad I got this one instead: I found that I did not need all those extra functions for extra $500. A great watch for regular runners.
customer_reviews.author: kohjack02

customer_reviews.title: Mixed review.
customer_reviews.text: Still getting to know the Forerunner 235, which I expect will work out. My issues relate to the display. Promotional and marketing photos of the watch while in timing mode show a bright white background with black numbers and letters. Actually, in normal timing mode the background is grey, turning to light grey at best when the backlight is engaged. Also, regardless of for how many seconds I set the “timeout “, the backlight turns off after about seven seconds. My expectation of the consistent bright white background was the deciding factor in choosing the 235 over a less expensive model. Having said all that, I do expect that the 235 will work out fine for me.
customer_reviews.author: edeinhaus

customer_reviews.title: It’s a good watch for gps.
customer_reviews.text: Don’t expect an accurate step meter or heart monitor. You can even take the watch off you it still “reads” your heart rate. You can see it rising and lowering just as if you were wearing it. For anyone curious about using it outside the US, I’ve used it in Japan and Australia.
customer_reviews.author: Sploodgemuffin

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Garmin watch to track my steps; wife has Fitbit. I have to say, it really has kept me on track with my fitness goals. I love the app, there's so much data to track. The user interface if fantastic. Battery life is also really good. It syncs nicely with my fitness pal, although sometimes I have to open apps twice to fully sync. My only complaint is that after a while, the band is causing a small rash on my wrist; may look into buying different material. Overall, this is a very nice watch.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy

customer_reviews.title: Great Fitness Watch
customer_reviews.text: This is my second 235. It provides all of the data I need. It tracks my step count. Has a very accurate GPS. It is great for running and works well for biking. On treadmill workouts you must allow your watch arm to swing freely. The only issue I have ever experienced was with an open box purchase. It didn't work correctly so I returned it and bought a new version. I use it daily and have been very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: Instant everything!
customer_reviews.text: My last running watch was the Polar M400 which bricked itself and was horrible at getting GPS and syncing. This watch doesn't have these problems at all! I've never seen a running watch acquire GPS faster. I hit the button inside and 5-10 seconds later it's done! Syncing with an iPhone over Bluetooth takes about 5-10 seconds as well - amazing. Also connected it to Mapmyrun and one the watch syncs with the Garmin Connect app the run shows up almost instantly in Mapmyrun.
customer_reviews.author: Leonid A. Malyutin

customer_reviews.title: Heard good things, confusing watch
customer_reviews.text: The app is amazing - the watch has so much to offer. I like how I don't have to worry about it getting wet. I'm still trying to figure out how to make the calendar Sync with my phone and to always make the notifications show. Right now it only does it if you recently opened the app. Update it works better with Android then apple
customer_reviews.author: Parisa

customer_reviews.title: Very innacurate
customer_reviews.text: I've tried this thing for a month now and have never been able to get an accurate heart rate reading. I have tried switching arms, tightening the band, shaving my arm, and still it gives a heart rate of 80 when my pulse is actually 160.
customer_reviews.author: YellowRocker

customer_reviews.title: Accurate and fast GPS! Great running watch!
customer_reviews.text: Extremely happy with this running watch. Good quality, GPS and heart rate are very accurate. The app works well and sinks up with strava with little effort. I am not utilizing the other "smart watch" features because I am only using the running features, if you want a minimum frills accurate running watch with am appt that will automatically save the details of your runs and provide analytics of your runs this watch is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: ryantlinder6

customer_reviews.title: Product not as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: The product I order gave no indication that it was used or opened. When I received the package, the watch had clearly been opened and the watch box was in disarray. I payed full price for this item and expected a brand new watch and for it to be in the sealed original packaging and that was not the case. This was a gift for my boyfriend as he just finished his masters degree and cannot walk across the stage with his classmates so I was very disappointed that after that, his graduation gift was not even as promised.
customer_reviews.author: Kasey Jones

customer_reviews.title: Great Watch
customer_reviews.text: This is a great watch. If you do buy this watch, I would suggest buying a screen protector for it. I did not buy a screen protector and I now regret it. My watch got scratched while doing yard work. I suggest you buy this watch and a screen protector. Great watch for the price. Also, if you use the watch a lot, you will have to charge it often. Hope this review helps.
customer_reviews.author: Theodore C.

customer_reviews.title: I you are a REAL runner, that's the product you are looking for
customer_reviews.text: Excellent Product. I can easily say that is one of the best activity tracker / heart rate monitor and somewhat smartwatch in the market. Pros. GPS Accuracy Comfortable Lightweight EXCELLENT BATTERY LIFE. I charge once a week, every Monday morning. With that charge I can do 2 x 1.5 mile GPS tracked walk 5 times a week and 1 x 3 mile run 7 times a week and I will have 10-15% battery remaining. 24/7 heart rate tracking sleep tracking waterproof (i never take it off, only when it is charging)
customer_reviews.author: mmori.usa

customer_reviews.title: Solid watch at a fair price.
customer_reviews.text: So far the Forerunner 235 has performed as advertised. There are pricier Garmin watches with more features, but I was not in search of bells and whistles. Just needed a reliable watch that would keep track of my runs, heart rate, and daily steps. The 235 does that and a little bit more.
customer_reviews.author: TG

customer_reviews.title: Nice every level
customer_reviews.text: Have used a few days now and don't have any complaints. Battery does drop quite a bit when using GPS, but expected from reviews and details read. Haven't got into all the features yet, but seems pretty comparable to the 735xt and at about $100 less. No issues with seeing the screen in the sunlight, band is comfortable, watch is super lightweight. Switched from a Fitbit Alta, love all the additional options and heart rate monitor, seems pretty accurate, chest strap would be better if you want most accurate, but a bit price tag comes with that. Overall a great watch.
customer_reviews.author: James D.

customer_reviews.title: This Watch Is Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I love this watch, I use it to track my road running for 5k prep and it works beautifully. Instead of having to carry a stopwatch or have my phone on an armband all I have to do is wear this watch. You can shower with it and submerge it in water anytime without ruining it. This watch is perfect for running. However, if you want a watch that can also play music to your headphones you want to consider the garmin 245 music or some other model. I don't listen to music when I run on the road so this watch is perfect for me.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: My bad.  User error
customer_reviews.text: If I could only get it paired to my iPhone. Believe me I’m trying. It’s not my phone. I pair everything but this 235 will not. update!! My fault. User error. I need to follow directions or follow the You Tube How To videos. This unit is perfect !!!
customer_reviews.author: JoeBoo24

customer_reviews.title: Very light!
customer_reviews.text: I was worried this watch would be a little bulky for a female wrist, but it’s incredibly light and lays flat against the entire wrist. I had the vivo active 3 and liked it, but this watch is half the weight and bulk
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Great Watch
customer_reviews.text: This is a great watch. I upgraded from a Garmin 25 after I had been running for a while. I like the heart rate tracker. Superficially I also like the wrist band color (teal), and the fact that I can make the background whatever I want it to be (a picture of a friend, a movie star, etc.) The battery lasts a long time so it's great for any distance. I also wear it all the time; I can wash dishes or shower with it on since it's water resistant. A great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Best GPS watch for the price
customer_reviews.text: I run 40-70 miles a week and wear it every day and it shows no signs of slowing down, which is good because neither do I. Would buy again any day. Reasonably accurate HR, although not perfect for hard workouts. Excellent GPS accuracy, connects fast. Has a few cool features including personalization. One complaint is not being able to view your stats/history without it trying to connect to GPS.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Great running watch
customer_reviews.text: Great running watch. The distance tracker seems to be very accurate. The "pacing" readout gets thrown off by things like swinging my arm out of the normal rhythm of my run or running under an overpass that presumably blocks the GPS signal. The wrist-based heart rate is good but not perfect. It also can be thrown off by arm-movement outside the normal range of exercise. Overall satisfied with the watch, and I believe the issues I have noted would be encountered with any similar product.
customer_reviews.author: SC_15

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good!
customer_reviews.text: I've only used it for running so far, but it's definitely easy to use once you get the hang of it. If you're not familiar with Garmin products (and their notoriously intricate menus), it might take some time to figure out how to program it to your liking, but aside from it not being the most overall user friendly, I'm impressed with it so far.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Caseltine

customer_reviews.title: Love this watch!
customer_reviews.text: This watch finds the GPS signal within seconds and is so much faster than my,prior 2 Garmin run watches. It has a variety of great features to track not only your runs but other activities as well. I even use to track my miles while walking the dog. If you are familiar with other Garmin watches it is pretty intuitive to use. The garmin connect app is really great to use and track all of your stats. I also like that it effortlessly syncs your runs via Bluetooth to my Nike Plus Run app. The heart rate tracking has been fairly accurate as well. Love love love this watch!
customer_reviews.author: MD2009

customer_reviews.title: Great runners watch for the data geek
customer_reviews.text: Great value for money and ideal for the typical enthusiastic amateur. Great basic data for driving simple training improvements. Simple to use. If your interested in improving the basics, this is ideal. If you are serious about optimizing details of your run dynamics without a run coach, you may want to get the pod and a more advanced model and more expensive Garmin model. This is not compatible with the pod or more advanced chest straps that can help with ground contact time reduction and balance. If your not worried about that (yet) this will give you what you likely need.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Extremely lightweight. Excellent battery life. GPS tracking very accurate. Heart rate and steps tracking appear to have decent accuracy during normal activities and while running. Customizable watch screens through Garmin App. Fashionable look with many outfits. Overall, highly recommend if you’re looking for a reasonably priced exercise watch that can be worn on a day-to-day basis. Only thing I would consider upgrading is to a model that stores Spotify songs. Only con I can think of is that group texts can not be read on the watch and there isn’t ability to respond through the watch like Apple products... you can simple use the watch for notification purposes.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Kraimer

customer_reviews.title: Favorite purchase of 2019
customer_reviews.text: I had an older garmin for years and was hesitant to purchase this watch because of the price, but I’m absolutely 100% obsessed with this product now ! If your someone who is serious about training, you need to have this watch. It’s a complete game changer.
customer_reviews.author: Girl on a budget

customer_reviews.title: Software too buggy - Not fixed for Years. Pass on this device
customer_reviews.text: I was highly disappointed to find that the software on this watch has had bugs for many years that have not been fixed by Garmin. This deals with Android and the notification feature of the software. All day long I receive false notifications that permissions are needed for calendar and other notifications to be shown, even when the permissions have been given. In further researching the product, I found that this is a long standing issue over several years that Garmin has not addressed. In order to fix the issue and stop the annoying notifications all day long, you have to disable the notification function. A really crappy option.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Clark

customer_reviews.title: Good running watch, HRM is limited
customer_reviews.text: Brief feedback after one week: Likes - comfort, appearance, functionality, size/weight, apps/customization, battery life, smart watch features, 24/7 resting/HR monitoring, running stats (HR, recovery advisor, VO2 MAX, race predictor) Dislikes - HRM performance for fitness (non running) activities and cycling, flexible band is comfortable but difficult to thread through, not sure how to record non-running or non-cycling exercise sessions (HR, calories, duration, etc.), takes lots of research to understand menus, options, etc.
customer_reviews.author: R. House

customer_reviews.title: Freezes and doesn’t work.
customer_reviews.text: So disappointed with this watch. I purchased a year ago for my wife. And she loves it when it works. But it freezes all the time. Loses data. We called for support and were offered very little assistance. My wife followed the recommended steps and now it is freezing every day vs once a week. It doesn’t charge right basically losing data every time she plugs it in.
customer_reviews.author: K J B

customer_reviews.title: Perfect watch for me
customer_reviews.text: I use watch for distance running (marathons) and step counting for company's wellness program. Upgraded to 235 from forerunner 110. The 235 gets GPS satellite very fast, 110 took forever. Suggest watching youtube for use instruction. Had a few questions for the Garmin tech team, they were patient and very responsive.
customer_reviews.author: NE USA Woman

customer_reviews.title: I have been through a LOT of watches and this is worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: I work out a lot and burn through watches, armbands, shoes, etc. I have struggled to find an accurate watch to track my workouts until my friend recommended this watch. I could talk about how much I like the lightweight feel and the large watch face that makes it easy to read while running or biking but what really has me thrilled about this watch is the batter life. If nothing else this watch could stand on only its battery life. I use it all day, and have at least six workouts a week and I charge it maybe once a week but I don't think it has every fully died on me. Amazing watch, would 100% recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Originally bought my sister a Fossil and what a disaster ...
customer_reviews.text: Originally bought my sister a Fossil and what a disaster of an xmas present that was. Didnt work right out of the box. Wouldnt charge or work. Returned immediately and bought her a Garmin. Battery lasts ten times longer than the Fossil watch when the Fossil watch works properly and has way more features. Dont waster your money on any other watch buy a Garmin. Just returned my Fossil because of issues. Looking at Garmin for myself.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Merritt

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME
customer_reviews.text: AWESOME...... but watch the glass on the watch face. I hit the corner of a table not to hard and the glass cracked. Garmin was very helpful and accommodating with getting a replacement. I bought the (2-Pack) Garmin Forerunner 235 225 Screen Protector Glass, Poyiccot Real 0.3mm Premium 2.5D Watch Tempered Glass Screen Protector Glass Film for Garmin.
customer_reviews.author: J McNamara

customer_reviews.title: Awesome watch until...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this watch for Christmas and have absolutely loved it until it started glitching - restarting in the middle of the day and losing data, un-syncing from phone and taking forever to sync again, etc. Was happy to use the 1 year warranty UNTIL I realized they were replacing it with a REFURBISHED watch. Did not spend almost $300 to have a used watch 10 months later!
customer_reviews.author: Teacher

customer_reviews.title: Great watch for running
customer_reviews.text: It’s a good watch for a runner but it’s not such a good “smart” watch. I bought it for tracking my runs and bike rides. It works good for that so I’m happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: sam b

customer_reviews.title: Difficult
customer_reviews.text: Difficult to program and low background light when trying to select options. Very frustrating. Returned
customer_reviews.author: Knucking Futz

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product.!
customer_reviews.text: I love my Garmin Forerunner 235. It tracks my miles, by mile, run and notifies me. Works great, long battery life, wonderful upload program. No issues. I had a Fitbit for 2-years and it stopped functioning with my Android. Absolutely No problems with my Garmin.!
customer_reviews.author: Betty

customer_reviews.title: Upgrade to the 245
customer_reviews.text: I have had my Garmin 235 for almost two years, and then all of the sudden it kept starting and shutting down. I called Garmin and they had me do all the re-sets etc. None of this worked, and they suggested sending in the old one and they would give me one for $110. I told them I would rather buy a new one, and the same problems happened with the new one, and the up and down buttons did not work unless the my phone was disconnected from the app. They are sending me an upgrade 245, and I will update my review when I receive it. Garmin customer has been great to work with .
customer_reviews.author: R. Lund

customer_reviews.title: Works well; Feels cheap
customer_reviews.text: Works as it should. Vibration is powerful - too much. Feels extremely cheap. Returned for that reason alone.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Lepore

customer_reviews.title: Buy it
customer_reviews.text: This watch is the best. It is a cheaper option of the fenix type garment watches. You still get to do a lot on it. It tracks my activities very accurately and the heart rate sensor is on point. Def recommend. This is my first smart watch and I love it. It shows me texts, and it tells me to move if I’m still to too long. All around a great watch.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla

customer_reviews.title: I was happy with that watch
customer_reviews.text: This is replacing my Garmin 230. I was happy with that watch. But got tired of issues with the HR bands so, decided to upgrade to the 235. Very happy I did. All the functions that I was used to with the 230 but not having to use the HR band since this one has a built in wrist sensor. This is my 3rd Garmin GPS running watch and I plan to keep using it for sometime!
customer_reviews.author: hockeykev

customer_reviews.title: Pleased with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: Love my watch. I got it for tracking my runs and it does just that. I used it for sleeping one night and it tracks well. There are more features to the watch but that is all I have used for now and I’m pleased with my purchase
customer_reviews.author: Nicole R.

customer_reviews.title: Good watch, but have some points that needs to be adressed
customer_reviews.text: I use the watch mostly for running and checking my heart rate. Compared to others this one gives me a pretty decent and stable reading. What I like are the available options and accuracy of the readings. Only 2 small dislikes 1. Watch is rather thick(sticks about 12mm out and second the race predictor gave a estimate race time about 7 minutes difference with my PR. None of the 3 races, 5k, 10k and HM matches, don't know how this is calculated or approximated
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great all around sport watch
customer_reviews.text: I use this watch for walking, biking, and overall daily monitoring of my activity level, Watch is great. Battery life is very good. If you use the GPS for long hours you may have an issue. I walk 4-5 miles a day or bike 30 miles with the GPS on and have not problem with the battery. I recharge if when I am in the shower and wear it almost constantly.
customer_reviews.author: DaveFL

customer_reviews.title: Do not purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this back in June 2019. It stopped working completely ( no charge, etc. ) in October 2019. Missed the amazon return window. Been dealing with Garmin directly and they are the worst customer service. Bottom line is that I am stuck with a $200 non working, completely dead Garmin. Do not buy! Worst customer service and amazon won’t help either.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen Sotiropoulos

customer_reviews.title: Still alerts you after being on DND
customer_reviews.text: Is very cheaply made, I’m a serious runner and basically just want a watch just to track my distance, that’s it. I don’t want to get alerts from text messaging , calls, social media messages and I get notifications non stop regardless of the settings I put in place, I even put it on DND and I’m still getting interrupted during my runs. This watch sucks
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this Garmin
customer_reviews.text: I had an older 235 Garmin. It was great, but it was heavy, wristband somewhat inflexible and sometimes would not charge properly. This new one is VERY impressive. It’s extremely light weight, battery lasts almost a full week with everyday runs, long weekend runs, as well as wearing as watch and fit bit. Syncs well with Garmin Connect. Has plenty of options for most runners and several screens of data, all of which can be customized. The charger is much easier to use than the older models. Would definitely give it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: JoyceS

customer_reviews.title: Why can't they fix longstanding app problems???
customer_reviews.text: So far, not so great. The directions for getting it up and running are not great, but I can figure it out. No matter what I do, though, I keep getting a "Sign in failed" message when I try to log in to the Garmin Connect mobile app, which you need to pair your phone via bluetooth. I can log in on my laptop, but not my phone. And there is no support on the weekends, because, I mean, who would need a workout watch on the weekends? Ugh. When I google "Sign in failed Garmin" there are complaints about this issue going back to 2015 with no offered solutions.
customer_reviews.author: Rikki

customer_reviews.title: Very good to track heart beat after COVID-19 side effects!
customer_reviews.text: I got one for my husband. He is having a hard time after getting the COVID-19 in March. This watch is helping him to check how he is doing while it is motivating him to exercise. Worth investment.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Screen is no where near as bright at pictured
customer_reviews.text: The screen on this device has no brightness adjustment, and DOES NOT LOOK ANYTHING LIKE PICTURED. It's far more pixelated, and the only reason the picture is so bright is because this is supposed to be some kind of reflective screen for better view in direct sunlight. I did not have that experience.
customer_reviews.author: KeensPurchaseRevs

customer_reviews.title: Nice but the 35 was fine
customer_reviews.text: I really loved my 35 and decided to upgrade to 235. Has to be even better, right? There really isn't much that this watch does that the 35 didn't do. I thought the race predictor would be a cool addition, but it grossly overestimates what I am capable of--i.e. not reliable. I still enjoy the watch but should have saved my money.
customer_reviews.author: englishteacher

customer_reviews.title: features a missing but documentation is not clear
customer_reviews.text: Bought this watch based on comparison with other forerunner watches and kept discovering that features are missing such as: pace alerts (high and low) and cadence alerts (high and low) to name a few. Garmin web site has product comparison feature that allows to compare this watch with other Garmin watches and alerting section is not part of comparison even though what is available as alert varies across watches. Also, wrist based optical HR is completely unpredictable - works during one run and does not work during another run.
customer_reviews.author: Quasimodo

customer_reviews.title: Garmin Forerunner 235 is a Failure
customer_reviews.text: I'd like to return this but it has been over 30 days. It did not come with the operating manual and I had to download and print the manual. The manual is important to know how to use it. Anyway, it no longer accepts a charge. It is over 50% charged, and I charge it every other day, but since yesterday it has not accepted the charge. This morning it would not work at all, giving me my speed rate for a bit, but no time or distance, then it reverted to a regular watch.
customer_reviews.author: slowjogger

customer_reviews.title: Watch is great! Once it locks on GPS the first time
customer_reviews.text: Watch is great! Once it locks on GPS the first time, which takes several minutes, it is almost instant afterwards. Syncs up to the app and my fitness pal great. No real complaints with the fitness side. I would like for Garmin to make the notification vibration stronger or longer in duration. One short buzz is often overlooked. That one flaw keeps me from making it my everyday watch. I still use my pebble when I'm doing something that I cannot miss a call or message. If garmin would fix that, I would only take it off to charge it.
customer_reviews.author: willdan

customer_reviews.title: Best running watch
customer_reviews.text: Love this watch. I read so many reviews to figure out which one I wanted. This watch is perfect for me. Very accurate on HR. Very easy use and easy to learn. The battery life varies on how much activity occurs but definitely last 3-4 days regardless. I have had this watch a year and it is still just as great. The best running watch I have used.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: BROKEN IN LESS THAN 9 MONTHS
customer_reviews.text: I bought this watch in November and by July it wasn't working properly. It no longer connects with GPS so it is useless for a runner who is training in any way. It no longer receives text messages and won't consistently connect with my headphones. It is a VERY EXPENSIVE alarm clock at this point.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica W MacGinnis

customer_reviews.title: 2 months old and the screen died
customer_reviews.text: Exactly 2 months old, and when I charged it at night to use the next day it was working fine. The next morning the screen was dead. I did all the restarts recommended and still nothing helped it. When I pressed the button for the light you could see a garbled lower right corner of the screen--that was it. I had to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca L.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Garmin Watch
customer_reviews.text: Excellent tracking of steps. Love the notifications of text messages. User friendly. The design is the best. My deciding decision for the Garmin Forerunner 235 over the Apple Watch is the big, round face on the watch. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: MEP

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this product from Amazon
customer_reviews.text: Initially I was really happy with my watch. However a few months in I had issues with the accuracy of the way the watch recorded my fitness. When I contacted Amazon, they said they could not help me because the time had run out on my return window. They suggested that I get in touch with Garmin which I did but they were not that helpful either, mostly because I did not buy the watch directly from them. It's a good product but I suggest that you purchase it at a store where you can return it if you have any problems.
customer_reviews.author: R. F. Gould

product_meta.title: Garmin Forerunner 235, GPS Running Watch, Black/Gray
product_meta.description:
Color:Black/Gray| Style:Watch OnlyStay on pace for your next personal record with Forerunner 235, the wrist based heart rate GPS and Glonass running watch with smart features1. It’s built in activity tracker2 keeps
recording steps, even when you’re not running. Pair your watch with a compatible phone for connected features1 like automatic uploads to Garmin connect, smart notifications, audio
prompts and live tracking. You can also download customizable watch faces and applications from Connect IQ. Measures heart rate at the wrist giving you the option to run without a
strap. For more challenging runs, download advanced workouts and training plans to your watch from Garmin Connect.
feature_bullets: GPS running watch with wrist based heart rate and display type is sunlight visible, transflective memory in pixel (MIP)
Customize your watch and your training, larger screen a 44 percentage larger screen than the 225 but the same physical size
Audio Prompts: Receive Audio Prompts from Your Connected Smartphone That Include Laps and Lap Times. Smartwatch Mode: Up to 9 days. GPS mode: Up to 11 hours
Smart notifications: See incoming email, text messages, call alerts, calendar reminders and more from your compatible smartphone. Display size: 1.23 inch diameter
Battery life 11 hours training, 9 days watch, activity tracking, notifications + heart rate. Refer user manual below

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars3,320 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
